page.title: 08YEAR 1912 cont.
page.content: Children went round singing and scrubbing doorsteps for a penny and twopence.Coal was moved about on barges and if they could not afford it they went down to see if any had been dropped.They used a bucket with holes in on the end of a pole to fish coal out of the canal.If they got more than they needed they would try to sell the rest for Â£0.02 per bucket. people did not travel very much.Only the rich had cars.most people travelled by trams or horse and cart. Goods such as coal were moved by horse pulling barges on the canals.
